The investigators could have prevented damage from an ambush or given the cultist more time to escape.

Because the players were set to explore the house anyway, and not getting the clue was not going to spoil anything.

The investigators could have taken damage from an ambush or provided time for the cultist to make his escape.

What are the consequences of missing the pushed roll in the Spot Hidden roll?
The consequences of missing the pushed roll could be that the investigators take damage from an ambush, or provide time for the cultist to make his escape.

Which skill to use for perception can be open to question, depending on the situation?

Which skill to use for perception can be open to question, depending on the situation. If a non-player character is about to draw a weapon to attack an investigator, the player might make a Spot Hidden roll to see the weapon being drawn or a Psychology roll to become aware of the non-player character’s intention.

How do the players choose to spend their time after missing a clue?
The investigators may choose to leave the house, or they may choose to spend more time searching, allowing the players to push the Spot Hidden roll.

What happens when the player makes a dice roll using the higher of the investigator’s two skills?
In this case, allow the player to make one dice roll using the higher of the investigator’s two skills.

The investigators take damage from an ambush, or provide time for the cultist to make his escape.

Either a Spot Hidden roll to see the weapon being drawn or a Psychology roll to become aware of the non-player character's intention.

By allowing the player to make a combined dice roll, comparing her rolled result to both Spot Hidden and Psychology.

Lord Foxton's anxiety and the sense that something is wrong.
